Fractal Noise

Use the controls below to play with fractal noise. Fractal noise is created by 'zooming in' on the noise surface at each point, multiple times, at multiple depths, to build a new noice surface that has properties of fractals. That is, as you zoom into the noise surface, the features you see will appear as noisy as the unzoomed image. In a real fractal, this is true in the limit to infinity. In this project, we stop after a certain number of 'zooms', that is, after including a certian number of octaves of noise.
